job_title: Registered Practical Nurse in Ottawa, ON
pros: nice staff, nice manager, good place to work
cons: no major cons during my time
you have to be willing to adapt to a new culture

pros: Had a great direct manager in my own team and the adjacent team did as well (but heard some real horror stories from other staff members around the hospital of extreme toxicity and even violent behaviors). Upper management did try to have a few campaigns to show appreciation to staff, such as offering a few special lunches or snacks and coffee days.
cons: Staff is overwhelmed and overworked. It did not help that I started at the beginning of the first covid wave, so I cannot speak about 'normal times', if there is such a thing anymore. Took ages to get help from IT, and they switched to the most ridiculous computer system in the middle of the covid crisis without any training or staff consultation, resulting in everyone's workload doubling (in some cases more than that). Staff morale was at an all time low. Did not feel like upper management listened to lower staff members or cared to consult them about hospital policies and projects. Majority of coworkers were aggressive and toxic. It felt impossible to manage the workload without doing overtime, and many staff members around me and in other units seemed to put in some extra time at least here and there. I have left on time once. Very limited options to eat lunch in the cafeteria, and apparently there was more than usual as a 'gift' to employees during covid, cannot speak to before. Bringing your own lunch to work was just about the only option. Unfortunately, the pandemic situation being what it is, even if asked for and approved in advance, time off can always be revoked at the last minute (even though I was non-medical staff), not sure how that would look like post-covid, hopefully it improves. Parking for employees is a bit of a problem.

pros: friendly co-workers, great doctors and a fun vibe when on night shifts
cons: very understaffed, management can be problematic depending on your manager

pros: amazing job to work, people so nice
cons: no cons i love my job

review_title: Good place, good people, and bad management
pros:
- Contribute to the health system and helping people;
- Plenty of good people trying to do the best they can.

You will have to live it to believe it!!  Incredible place to work.  A familial spirit, hard working employees and safety oriented.  Multiple employee programs to promote health and wellness. 
Studer and Ideal programs implemented and working very well.
cons:
Life and work balance not always easy. 
High stress levels in some departments result in high employee turnover or stress leaves.
